Industries: Concerts, Digital Entertainment, Event Management, Event Promotion, Events, Media and Entertainment, Ticketing
Industry Groups: Events, Media and Entertainment
Description: Live Nation Entertainment is the live entertainment and eCommerce company.
Full Description: Live Nation Entertainment Inc, the world’s live entertainment company, combines several entertainment brands, including Ticketmaster.com, Live Nation Concerts, the Live Nation and Live Nation Productions.   Live Nation began as SFX Entertainment, a part of SFX Broadcasting, and then became a division of Clear Channel Communications. It became its own entity in 2005 with Michael Rapino as President and CEO. Since then, Live Nation has provided live entertainment services to fans in over 40 countries around the world through promotion and hundreds of entertainment venues. Live Nation partnered with Ticketmaster, the global leader in live event ticketing, in 2010 to form Live Nation Entertainment. This relationship has allowed both companies to expand their reach to help more fans experience the power of live each year.   Live Nation Concerts produces over 35,000 live music events annually in conjunction with Live Nation Entertainment’s 4,000+ touring artists. Live Nation fully acquired Front Line Management Group in 2011, giving the company access to the artists it represents, now numbering over 500, including top acts such as Chicago, Alan Jackson and Jimmy Buffett. Each of these businesses supports the Live Nation Network, the leading provider of entertainment marketing solutions. Live Nation Network connects more than 1000 advertisers to its network of consumers through Live Nation live event and digital platforms. Live Nation Entertainment has recently focused investments on profitable music festivals and initiatives associated with them. Some of the festivals Live Nation Entertainment has a controlling stake in include Lollapalooza and Bonnaroo. They also have a partnership with Insomniac who runs the Electric Daisy Carnival. Part of these investments include upgrading facilities at the festivals, including adding permanent bathrooms and running water. Live Nation Entertainment has an international presence, which has allowed them to acquire businesses around the world including the House of Blues (2006), a United States concert promoter; Union Events in Canada (2016) and Mainland Music (2018), based in Switzerland. It has also gained majority interest in AC Entertainment (2016), the Sweden Rock Festival (2016), Australia’s Secret Sounds Group (2016) and DF Entertainment (2018).

Description: LogRhythm is a NextGen SIEM Platform combining advanced security analytics, UEBA, NDR, and SOAR in a single end-to-end solution.
Full Description: LogRhythm is a world leader in NextGen SIEM, empowering thousands of enterprises on six continents to successfully reduce cyber and operational risk by rapidly detecting, responding to, and neutralizing damaging cyberthreats. The LogRhythm NextGen SIEM Platform combines advanced security analytics; user and entity behavior analytics (UEBA); network detection and response (NDR); and security orchestration, automation, and response (SOAR) in a single end-to-end solution. LogRhythm’s technology serves as the foundation for the world’s most modern enterprise security operations centers (SOCs), helping customers measurably secure their cloud, physical, and virtual infrastructures for both IT and OT environments. Built for security professionals by security professionals, the LogRhythm NextGen SIEM Platform has won a countless customer and industry accolades.

Description: Cvent delivers the most comprehensive event marketing & management platform, maximizing the impact of in-person, virtual, and hybrid events.
Full Description: Cvent is a leading meetings, events, and hospitality technology provider with nearly 4,000 employees, 30,000 customers, and 300,000 users worldwide. Founded in 1999, the company delivers the most comprehensive event marketing and management platform and offers a global marketplace where event professionals collaborate with venues to create unmatched experiences. Cvent is headquartered in McLean, Virginia, just outside of Washington D.C., and has additional offices in London, Frankfurt, Dubai, Melbourne, New Delhi, and Singapore among others, to support its growing global customer base. The comprehensive Cvent event marketing and management platform offers software solutions to event organizers and marketers for online event registration, venue selection, event marketing and management, virtual and onsite solutions, and attendee engagement. Cvent’s suite of products automate and simplify the entire event management process and maximize the impact of in-person, virtual, and hybrid events.  Hotels and venues use Cvent’s supplier and venue solutions to win more group and corporate travel business through Cvent’s sourcing platforms and to service their customers directly, efficiently and profitably – helping them grow and own their business. Cvent solutions optimize the entire event management value chain and have enabled clients around the world to manage millions of meetings and events.

Description: FanWide is a free website and app that connects sports fans from every team in any city with fan clubs and game watch parties at sports bar.
Full Description: December 2017 - FanWide has received written commitments for funding that exceeds this $2,000,000 Series A round.  they are continuing to accept investments at the current $8,000,000 valuation for a short time. Please visit our investor's portal at http://fanwi.de/InvestFanWide for the most updated information about FanWide. FanWide is a free website (http://www.FanWide.com) and app (iOS and Android) that connects sports fans from every team in any city. FanWide promotes in-person game watch parties and develops local fan communities for every pro, college, and international team at sports bars nationwide. These venues bid against each other to host the event using FanWide's patent-pending event auction system, and the hosts guarantee that the team's games will be featured with sound! Fan clubs and alumni associations can use FanWide's services to expand their network, organize events, communicate with local fans, collect and report attendance data, enter contests, receive donations, and activate food or drink discounts from the event host or team sponsors. Sports teams and leagues can use FanWide's Sports Data Platform to analyze fan engagement, and all of FanWide’s services can be integrated within the team’s own website or app. Incentivized by promotions and discounts, fans from around the country can check in at events and report watch party attendance. This is used to improve accuracy for Out-Of-Home TV ratings, so broadcast and advertising partners will see a measurable increase in viewership among the younger audience that is unsubscribing from cable. FanWide also offers partners new targeted advertising channels through its digital platform and on-site activation at in-person events nationwide which function like an "extended stadium". Since launching in 2016, Seattle-based FanWide has promoted over 350,000 events at 9,000 hosts for 10,000 fan clubs!  Millions of out-of-market fans can use the free FanWide website or app to find the closest viewing party for their favorite team, wherever they are living or traveling.   Long-term FanWide wants to provide the world's leading platform to automatically match hosts with fans of any interest group, including TV shows, gaming, politics, board games, trivia, and more.

Description: Gigit is an online platform for locating musical bands and artists for parties and other events.
Full Description: Gigit is a service that allows you to Book-a-Band for a party.  Gigit is solving a multibillion-dollar event-booking problem while simultaneously creating more opportunities for artists to get paid to play their music. The process of booking a band or DJ is complex, confusing, and slowed by too many middlemen. Further to this, the music industry is hitting a point of stagnation in revenues. We live in a streaming world and no longer have to pay for music. Piracy is afoot, but you cannot pirate a live experience: Enter Gigit. For musicians, we exhibit a number of outside the box opportunities to get paid, create bespoke experiences with fans, and gain assets (content) that will drive more bookings. For the event planner, we create a transparent, succinct process in which you can discover bands, both up and coming or established, and book them as easily as you book a room, a car, or a dog sitter... a la AirBnb, or Dog Vacay. Marketplaces and collaborative consumption models are top of mind and serve as the new baseline in our day-to-day lives. Gigit's design, UX and data will serve as the driving forces as to why we are the place where bands and DJs go to get booked and everyone else will go to book live music.

The company curates accurate personality profiles using social data. To infer personality characteristics from textual information, SocialCapital tokenizes the input text and matches the tokens with the LIWC psycholinguistics dictionary to compute scores in each dictionary category. It currently infers personality characteristics and interests from any combination of tweets, blogs, and any other publically available digital media. SocialCapital was founded in 2015 by Temitope Alabi and Obed Eugene.

Description: BusyEvent is a live event customer relationship management company providing professional-grade mobile event creation tools for producers.
Full Description: BusyEvent is a live event CRM company monetizing the hundreds-of-millions of face-to-face interactions that occur at conferences, trade shows and business to business events each year.  Expensive to produce, inefficient and seemingly stuck in a 20-year old model, the 14,000 live events that occur in North America alone have become, tragically, a place where good leads go to die.   BusyEvent licenses an easy to customize, live event mobile cloud app that makes any trade show or conference easier to manage and more profitable to produce.  By tracking buyer behavior before, during and after an event and then filtering the overload of data into actionable information, they create revenue streams for their event producer clients, from the more than 10MM attendees and 2MM vendors; all of whom can use, BusyEvent.

Additionally, the Diobox iPhone and iPad apps provide full functionality to cover the entire event lifecycle from start to finish, helping event planners manage small or large events on the go. Diobox is about simplifying the convoluted process of hosting and managing events. Full Description: Karma411 is a B2B Enterprise Event Engagement platform that combines Peer to Peer communication with Event Management functions such as selling tickets, raising money, and raising awareness.   Karma411 allows enterprise clients to reach more people & sell more tickets for their events.  Through “friends asking friends”, Karma411  turns supporters into active participants &  attendees  and allows administrators to easily measure the effectiveness of events such as Galas, Business Events,  Walks, Marathons, Golf Outings, Competitions etc.   The company focuses on the sports, non-profit, corporate, entertainment and transportation sectors. Industry Groups: Events, Media and Entertainment, Mobile
Description: Whova provides Mobile Event Solutions to help event to be more successful and facilitate attendees networking at the events.
Full Description: Whova is a mobile event management app designed to assist event attendees navigate through their events with mobile brochures and facilitate networking among all event attendees based on their professional profiles, which are automatically generated from relevant professional information assembled from the entire internet using its big data analytic and mining technology. It is designed with a wide target spectrum that includes corporate and social events, trade-shows & expos, conferences, performances, workshop, Meetup (website), and more. Check out and request a demo from http://whova.com As of February 2014, Whova operates on both the iOS and the Android systems. However, for both platform, the interface is subject to customization by the event organizers. Therefore, the interface that a user experiences will depend largely on the preference of the event organizer. An email verification is generally required to access the customized interfaces of specific events. Once in, users can then proceed to access certain key features, such as information about the event, GPS guidance, and options to communicate with the event organizers or other attendees. As of February 2014, Whova released social sign-in/up options to allow users access to Whova via their social accounts, and as of March 2014, Whova launched a messaging feature that allows an event attendee the option to send e-messages to other people of interest. Event Brochure: The event brochure section is generally visible to event attendees by default. The agenda and event logistics will be constantly accessible to users. However, organizers can choose what additional information to relay, such as whether or not to provide indoor maps, additional information links, live streaming, or GPS guidance. Networking: Upon initial sign-up, all users will be provided with a profile page, featuring their professional accomplishments compiled from publicly available on the internet. Users utilize the discover feature to can view each other's profiles and interact using the messaging feature. Messages sent through the app are subject to nondisclosure guidelines. Any information, such as email addresses and phone numbers, will not be visible to the receiver. You can also use the Whova app to digitize and manage business cards you have received even if you do not attend any events. Different from all the other business card reader apps like CamCard, CardMunch, ScanBizCards or Scannable etc, you can gain deep insights on your contacts' experiences, passions, and interests. Now Whova business card scanning feature supports cards in English, Chinese, and Korean. More details are available on http://whova.com/feature/

Description: Startup Grind is a global startup community designed to educate, inspire, and connect entrepreneurs.
Full Description: Startup Grind is the world’s largest community of startups, founders, innovators, and creators. We bring like-minded yet diverse individuals together to connect, learn, teach, help, build, and belong. We do this daily through our local events, flagship conferences, startup program, partnerships, and online media + content - collectively reaching over 3.5 million individuals worldwide. The company hosts monthly events in more than 600 cities and 125 countries featuring successful local founders, innovators, educators and investors who share personal stories and lessons learned on the road to building great companies. The company's monthly fireside chat interviews, startup mixers and annual conferences provide ample opportunities to connect with amazing startups and the people behind them, tap into a strong support network, form meaningful connections and gain inspiration for the startup journey ahead.  Started by Derek Andersen and Spencer Nielsen in February 2010 in a small office in Mountain View California, the original goal to bring together friends who would help each other has spread across the world.

Full Description: Constant Contact provides email marketing, social media marketing, event marketing, and online survey tools to help small organizations grow their businesses by building stronger customer relationships. More than 500,000 small businesses, nonprofit organizations, and member associations rely on Constant Contact's easy-to-use, affordable online tools to create and deliver personalized, professional communications that engage customers, members and prospects wherever they congregate online -- from their email inboxes to their social networks. Launched in 1998, Constant Contact made email marketing simple for small organizations and continues this tradition today providing the education and tools to make social media marketing simple for small organizations as well. As an industry leader in permission based online marketing, Constant Contact partners with the leading providers of online marketing and social media marketing solutions. Constant Contact welcomes developers and partners to utilize its API and contribute to its Constant Contact App MarketPlace.

Full Description: Avature is a highly flexible enterprise SaaS platform for Global Talent Acquisition and Talent Management, and the leading global provider of CRM for recruiting. Avature’s vision is to support strategic HR initiatives by introducing a consumer web quality platform that can be customized quickly and easily by their customers - allowing them to design and implement innovative programs to compete for and retain talented people. Their technology focuses on engagement and is designed to enable end-to-end service delivery to stakeholders and to contribute to the digital transformation of the enterprise. Used in 90 countries and 16 languages, Avature has over 400 customers of which 101 are Fortune 500 organizations. Avature delivers its private cloud services from data centers in the US, Europe, and Asia, and has offices in Buenos Aires, London, Madrid, Melbourne, Munich, New York, Paris, Singapore, and Shenzhen. www.avature.net

Full Description: BookBottles makes the entire bottle service experience seamless – for you and your clients. Our premier service enables you to easily manage table inventory, guest lists, client profiles and transactions to ensure your staff knows every client on a personal basis. Now that’s VIP service. We saw an opportunity – nightclubs worldwide were not maximizing their full profit potential. Why? It all comes down to logistics. Many clubs do not store guest profiles efficiently, making it laborious to identify high-profile guests at the door and serve them with the VIP status they deserve. What's more is staff is not equipped with the technology necessary to provide seamless VIP service. This translates to lost opportunities and revenue. And thus, BookBottles was created. We make the entire bottle service experience seamless – for you and your clients. Description: Accelevents is a powerful but affordable all-in-one virtual event platform.
Full Description: Accelevents is a powerful but affordable all-in-one virtual event platform. The platform offers robust virtual event hosting features including ticket sales, live streaming, live chat and polling, virtual exhibitor booths, breakout sessions, A.I. powered networking, gamification, and more. It creates a virtual experience that the attendees remember. They also provide a built-in production studio or built it. It is clear the platform was built with a recognition that events are about building relationships and making connections. The A.I. based networking tools ensure that attendees build lasting professional relationships throw 1:1 video speed dating, discussion group, watch parties, fireside chats, and AMAs. There is a full suite of analytics tools to help in identifying which sessions or speakers performed the best and even measure the ROI of a virtual exhibitor booth. The user can create a virtual expo and sell exhibitor booths that allow exhibitors to host live demos, chat with attendees, schedule meetings, add marketing material, and more. The virtual lobby allows attendees to access a news feed bulletin, their agenda, see sponsors or even shop in your store. Accelevents also offers numerous features for in-person or hybrid events.

Organization Name: Adrienne Arsht Center for Performing Arts
Industries: Association, Communities, Education, Event Management, Events, Performing Arts, Restaurants
Industry Groups: Community and Lifestyle, Education, Events, Food and Beverage, Media and Entertainment, Other
Description: Adrienne Arsht Center for Performing Arts is one of the world's leading performing arts organizations and venues
Full Description: Set in the heart of downtown Miami and designed by world-renowned architect Cesar Pelli, the Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts of Miami-Dade County is one of the world's leading performing arts organizations and venues. Since opening in 2006, the Arsht Center, a 501C3 non-profit organization, has emerged as a leader in presenting innovative programming that mirrors South Florida's diversity as well as a catalyst for billions of dollars in new development in the downtown area. Spotlighting legends and serving as a launch pad for local artists to make their mark on the international stage, the Center presents nearly 400 events each year across its flexible, state-of-the-art performance spaces. The Center programs several Signature Series, including the largest jazz series in South Florida, a major annual Flamenco Festival, and a robust program of new theatrical works as well as free programming for the community and an arts education program that serves nearly 60,000 children each year. As Miami's new Town Square, the Arsht Center also houses BRAVA by Brad Kilgore, a fine dining restaurant; the Café at Books & Books in the historic Carnival Tower and a weekly Farmers Market. Visit arshtcenter.org for more information.

Industries: Event Management, Events, Local, Search Engine, Transaction Processing
Industry Groups: Events, Financial Services, Internet Services, Media and Entertainment, Payments, Sales and Marketing, Software
Description: LocalRaces is an event management platform that provides technology to create experiences and make event management profitable.
Full Description: WE PROVIDE RACE DIRECTORS THE TECHNOLOGY TO CREATE EXPERIENCES PARTICIPANTS WILL LOVE AND TO MAKE EVENT MANAGEMENT EASIER AND MORE PROFITABLE. LocalRaces.com is more than online race registration and event management software in the $2 billion endurance event market.  Our technology creates a great event experience for runners, cyclists, and triathletes.  From driving new participants, to collecting data insights that result in better decisions, to offering timesaving automated processes that sets our clients apart from their competition, we make managing endurance events more efficient and profitable. The company acts as a payment facilitator for both race directors and managers of running and cycling clubs.  We process race participant, sponsor, and club member registrations, both online and onsite, utilizing our mobile credit card readers.  The company charges a $1.50 + 6% processing fee to registrants, while providing in-kind event management SaaS solutions to the race directors.  Our all-in-one web-based software suite includes registration, volunteer, sponsor, advertising, and vendor management solutions.   Athletes sign up for our clients’ events and clubs on LocalRaces.com, the nation’s largest network of local running and cycling communities, where we host thousands of event, club, and trail profiles in all 381 U.S. metropolitan areas.  We provide every registered athlete web-based tools and mobile applications to manage their upcoming race itineraries, past results, club memberships, personal records, goals, and training runs and rides.  The company generates additional revenues from our network of media properties via featured event paid listings, display ads, and from 3rd party offerings to our registered athlete database of highly affluent consumers in the $8 billion running shoe and apparel market. Our sites and mobile applications are powered by our proprietary LocalRaces API, which aggregates race event, trail, club, and athlete meta data supplied by athletes, race directors, other event engines, race result databases, and training applications like Strava and Garmin.  Opening our API to 3rd party web and mobile app development will generating additional registrations and ad revenues.

Description: Online marketplace for dog professionals
Full Description: Zooza is an online marketplace that connects professional dog owners with clubs and events around the world.  Zooza targets dog clubs and independent event secretaries to help them create landing pages on the Zooza website about their events. Then, participants can enter the event online through the Zooza website, including paying fees. The Zooza platform handles out-bound promotion of events posted, provides a workflow engine for processing entrants, and manages the flow of money between participants and the organizer. Description: Belly Ballot is a website that helps parents find a name for their baby by crowdsourcing the process.
Full Description: Belly Ballot makes naming your baby more fun. In under 2 minutes, parents can choose their favorite baby names and invite friends and family to vote via Facebook and Twitter.  Similar to the traditional baby shower, we’ve created a whole new social event for parents to include loved ones on the joyous occasion of celebrating a new child’s life...and win prizes in the process! Here's how it works:   -Parents create their Belly Ballot and select their favorite names.  Then, they invite friends and family to vote via email, Twitter, or directly from Facebook.   -Loved ones from all over the globe arrive to comment, suggest additional names, and finally cast their votes.  -By casting their votes, they can win the parents great prizes like strollers, cribs and other baby products. The Belly Ballot with the most votes each week wins! -Once they've decided on that perfect name, it’s time to announce the winner.  Unveiling the final choice to the world requires just a click of a button and everyone is immediately notified.  That’s it.  Simple, easy, and fun.  For any further inquiries, please get in touch.  We'd love to hear from you!

Description: Evite, an online personal party planning service, offers tools for planning recipes and a wine-pairing chart, the process and themes.
Full Description: Evite.com is an online personal party planning service.  When party hosts log onto Evite.com they have access to a plethora of tools to help them during every step of the event planning process.  This includes a checklist tool to keep track of party tasks, a budget estimator, customizable invitations, a drink calculator, eCards for after party thank-yous, and a "My Notebook" section to save ideas and other notes.  Evite also helps hosts by offering party theme ideas, recipes, a wine-pairing chart and more. The site has more than 15 million registered users and it facilitates more than 16 million invitations to more than 450,000 events each month.  Evite was initially acquired by Ticketmaster in 2001, which was then acquired by IAC (NASDAQ: IACI) in 2003. On December 2, 2010, Evite was acquired by Liberty Media in an exchange from IAC.

Description: Indoor navigation system for expo centers with the function of a multimedia interactive guide.
Full Description: The IN is a solution for expo centers with the function of a multimedia interactive guide-navigator. The solution solves the problem of indoor positioning, finding a route to the desired object, getting information on objects.  The core of the solution is a self-developed unique algorithm that uses sensors of mobile devices and provides a 1,5-meter accuracy which is the highest possible for iBeacons technology. With our solution, we can quickly build client-oriented applications, and to deploy customized solutions on the customer's site, and also brand them if necessary. With the app, visitors can navigate indoors at the event, get multimedia info on objects and premises, use in-app text search. An essential part of the app is a built-in chat where visitors can communicate, make appointment indicating a place on the plan, contact exhibitors.  The owner of the system also known as the owner of the expo center gets access to marketing, analytical and logistical information, and opportunities of additional revenue directly and indirectly.  We know how to take steps more precisely than fitness bracelets.

Description: Crisis and Emergency Management, Team Communications, and Automated Workflow Solutions - SaaS, Cloud, No-Code
Full Description: The Virtual Emergency Operations Center: Cloud-based, no-code workflow, task, communication, and coordination platform. Quality, security, availability for the enterprise with a consumer-web user interface for ease of use and lack of a need for training. 100% web, 100% mobile, and 100% SaaS. Get started in minutes. When stakes are high, teams of people need to be coordinated. When the response time is in minutes and hours, not weeks and months. When teams need to communicate amongst themselves as well as with other teams, and noise is an issue. When a preplanned timed response with people, tasks and resources is essential. When teams can be anywhere and mobile operation - PDAs to simple cell phones - is a requirement. For the enterprise where security, customer response, IT outages and other disruptions are primary concerns. For municipalities, local and state governments who require organized responses to weather and disaster-related events. For universities to use in pre-planned actions for campus emergencies - bomb threats, earthquakes, fires, power outages, severe weather, suspicious activity, active shooters, hazardous material release - and regular events such as sports games, student gatherings, and commencements. For the transportation industry - airports, airlines, shipping, terminal operations - in which operations are highly time-sensitive and streamlined, customer service is paramount, and keeping costs down is an imperative.  For Utilities who must maintain service through weather events and disasters, and who face specific distribution and resource allocation issues. For retailers who need to react to the aftermaths of major crises with supply chain redirection and coordination.

Industry Groups: Content and Publishing, Events, Media and Entertainment
Description: e.Republic is a media and research company focused on state and local government and education.
Full Description: Established in 1984, e.Republic is the nation’s only media and research company focused exclusively on state and local government and education. Led by Dennis McKenna, media entrepreneur and co-founder, their award-winning publications, websites, more than 150 annual events and highly respected research operations are acknowledged as setting the gold standard in their respective fields. Their work has been cited in The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Forbes, Time magazine, The Washington Post and USA Today. In 1985, McKenna launched California County magazine in partnership with the California State Association of Counties. Early to recognize the impact new digital technologies would have on the public sector, in 1987, Dennis launched Government Technology, the first national magazine covering information technology in state and local government. Other successful media platforms followed, including Public CIO and Emergency Management. All have won numerous editorial and design awards. In 2013, Emergency Management magazine was named Magazine of the Year for overall excellence by ASBPE (American Society of Business Publication Editors), Public CIO was named Magazine of the Year in 2007 and Government Technology and Emergency Management have both been named best publication in their respective categories by the Western Publishing Association. Seeing the need for stronger analysis and research to support public sector innovation, Dennis developed the Center for Digital Government—the first-of-its-kind research and business intelligence advisory institute focused exclusively on state and local government. The Center is home to the widely cited Digital States Survey. In 2009, e.Republic acquired Governing from Congressional Quarterly. Governing covers politics, policy and management for state and local government leaders. Recognized as the most credible and authoritative voice in its field, Governing provides non-partisan news, insight and analysis on budget and finance; transportation and infrastructure; workforce and economic development; health and human services and more. Since the acquisition, the publication has grown, with an expanded online presence and launch of the Governing Institute, headed by former Kansas City Mayor Mark Funkhouser. Governing has also greatly expanded its national events portfolio. In 2011 Governing received the prestigious Jesse H. Neal Award from American Business Media for exceptional editorial content. With over 200 employees in California, Washington, D.C. and throughout the United States, e.Republic is a unique company redefining the role of media at the intersection of innovation and public service.

Full Description: FanMob is a social polling platform for online publishers to interact with their audience, expand their reach, and leverage data to create better content. FanMob tracks data associated with voters' interactions, social-graphs, demographics, etc. to help publishers understand their core audience and tailor their content to better engage (and monetize) their audience. Interactive FanMob polls are also accessible to communities of content consumers (e.g., sports fans) via a proprietary micro-engagement application. This product is focused on the aggregation, curated delivery, and gamified consumption of interactive polls (ie, "Quiz Up for sports fans").

Description: Accelerating the Future: TechFire's programs and events feature titans of tech.
Full Description: FEATURED IN TECHMEME’S LIST OF NATIONALLY– & INTERNATIONALLY–SIGNIFICANT TECH EVENTS From autonomous vehicles, to all manner of startups, TechFire is focused on accelerating the future. Founded in 2013 and regarded as a tech conference powerhouse, TechFire has been recognized in the industry arbiter TechMeme’s list of nationally– and internationally–significant tech conferences. TechFire’s summit on the Self-Driving Car Revolution was broadcast on national television on C-SPAN. We have hosted 35 events with 6685 registrants across both our own in-house events sponsored by Fortune 500 & industry-leading giants, and award-winning events for consulting clients.  Just a few of our past speakers include VCs from Kleiner Perkins, SV Angel, Greylock, CRV, & Lightspeed; founders of hot startups like Aurora, HotelTonight, about.me, and Factual; CEOs who went on to billion-dollar exits (Dollar Shave Club and BlackLine); elected officials; and C‑Level executives from giants like Warner Bros. and PBS. Learn more at techfire.co. Who we are: TechFire is led by Founder/CEO David C. Murphy. Before TechFire, David founded and led a high-profile transportation group where he raised funding from Elon Musk, the David Bohnett Foundation, Google, Uber, and Lyft, and drove coverage by the New York Times, Good Morning America, Bloomberg, and the L.A. Times front page.  David graduated from Claremont McKenna College, and in high school, cofounded Hotline Communications, whose chat software was used by millions of consumers and by companies like General Motors and Apple. The Toronto Star called Hotline “a major force in the online world.” at the time. Active in policy and politics, at TechFire David has been tapped by the  World Economic Forum to participate in working groups on the future of the internet and cybersecurity.

Description: GreenRope® provides a user-friendly all-in-one solution to consolidate, simplify and automate your daily sales and marketing operations.
Full Description: GreenRope Complete CRM and marketing automation delivers a comprehensive solution to help your team do more with less. With sales, marketing and operations all built-in to the same system, you become a lean, data-driven organization. Increase collaboration, drive sales, build better relationships, and deliver optimized omnichannel customer experiences. The GreenRope platform was developed to help businesses consolidate their technology stack to help them become more productive, while also saving valuable resources like time and money. GreenRope, on average, saves users 90% in total cost of ownership when investing in a full-featured solution. With our robust feature offering, each of your departments can work effectively in the CRM while also having access to customer service, marketing, operations, and more.  Our pricing model is different from competitors in that we base our pricing on the number of contacts in your CRM, rather than the number of users. This means, you do not have to pay for every user to have their own login and password. Instead, each employee can have their own password and login with specific access permissions, all for the price of a single subscription cost. Our system is built on the concept that when the entire team works in the same software, as a business, you get full transparency into your efforts, business performance, team projects, the customer experience, and more. This model helps businesses save hundred to thousands of dollars each year. Your pricing is based on actual business growth, NOT the size of your team.  GreenRope's all-in-one CRM, marketing automation, and operations solution is built for businesses wanting to establish more effective business processes and deliver better customer experiences for optimal growth.  What are GreenRope’s main features?  CRM:  As a Complete CRM, we offer CRM as the foundation, housing all of your contacts and data. Along with a secure database, you have access to full pipeline visibility, contact research, CRM activities, workflows, sales opportunity management, quotas, reporting, click-to-call, mobile CRM, and much more. Each of these features ties directly into the contact record, so you have a 360-degree view of the contact and your relationship with that contact. You can then use all of this data to drive your marketing initiatives, as well as provide context for more productive sales and customer service calls. Our CRM is so robust, offering sales professionals, business owners, customer service reps, and marketing execs, access to the data they need to do their jobs effectively. GreenRope also offers a mobile app for on the go data management.  Marketing Automation:  Our marketing automation tools are incredibly powerful and help businesses bridge the gap between sales, marketing, and operations. Our drag-and-drop customer journey builder is your one-stop shop for creating seamless customer experiences. Use the email builder to create professional looking, mobile responsive emails, then test them out using our campaign optimizer. Automate specific actions when recipients open or click on your emails and send each down tailored customer paths. Our landing pages & signup forms make it easy to generate new leads and automatically add them to your CRM and any customer journeys. Plus, our A/B testing makes it simple to track performance from each of your campaigns.  Our automation viewer allows you to view all of the automation setup in your account, giving you the whole pictures, so you can actively see how client's move through your customer lifecycle.  Operations:  Just as important as sales and marketing is operations. GreenRope gives business owners full control over their entire business and this includes document signing, customer service, project management, learning management, event management and more. Our ticketing feature helps team manage customer service inquiries and other requests. You can automatically assign tickets to different people on your team based on rules, trigger automation, and activate reminders to make sure nothing slips through the cracks. GreenRoe's project management tool is a powerful way to track both internal and customer facing projects. Share updates with clients, track billable hours, set a timer, and more. Along with these two powerful features, GreenRope offers digital document signing, event management, and a learning management feature, all included with every GreenRope account. A list of all GreenRope features. Sales - Complete CRM - Workflows  - CRM activities & notes  - Contact management - Sales opportunity management - Database management tools - Reporting - Custom user-fields - Custom objects - Automatic contact research - Booking calendar - SMS/MMS marketing - Click-to-call  - eCommerce - Mobile app - Team calendaring - Affiliate marketing software - Digital document signing  - Lead scoring - Predictive analytics   Marketing - Marketing automation - Website builder - Email marketing - Customer journey mapping - Landing page builder - Social networking - Web analytics - Drag-and-drop email builder - Signup forms - Email tracking  - Workflow manager - Drip campaigns - Surveys - Video tracking - Mobile app - Email & landing page templates - Split (A/B testing) campaigns - SMS/MMS/Voice broadcast campaigns   Operations - Project management - Event management - Learning management system - Ticketing for customer service  - Contact management - Collaborative Wiki  - Command center - ESignature - Shared access  - Live chat integration - Phone tree management   Who does GreenRope integrate with?  While we integrate with a plethora of tools using Zapier & PieSync, we natively integrate with:  - Juvo Leads - Olark Live Chat  - Zapier - PieSync - PayPal - Authorize.net - BlueSnap - WordPress - GoToMeeting - Gmail & Google Analytics - SendForensics  - Postalyics  - FullContact  - e-Hawk - QuickBooks - Evernote - Outlook  What does GreenRope’s pricing model look like?  All packages come with unlimited users, unlimited emails, and all of the features. You also get a choice between our standard account setup package and our premium account package. Both are designed to help get our new users up and running quickly.  Our packages include:  - Starter > Up to 1000 contacts  - Prime  > Up to 3000 contacts  - Pro > Up to 5000 contacts - Premium > Up to 7500 contacts  - Powerhouse > Up to 10000 contacts  - Supreme > Up to 25000 contacts  - Ultimate > Up to 50000 contacts  **Custom packages available.

Description: SimpleRegistry is an online registry service that enables users to build their registries with items, activities, and experiences.
Full Description: Get creative - put anything you can find or think of on one (awesome) registry. SimpleRegistry is similar to a traditional registry in which you register for the individual gifts you would like to receive. However, with SimpleRegistry, anything you can think of and assign a cost to can be added to your registry. In one-click, use the SimpleAdder to add any item on any site to your registry. Also use the free SimpleRegistry mobile app to scan the barcode or take a snapshot of any item in any store or any experience  and add it to your registry. If you have trouble coming up with great items to register, let your friends & family recommend items they love with our Item Suggestions feature. Easily build your registry with items, activities, and experiences you'd like to receive and guests contribute monetary gifts towards them. You can also split expensive gifts into any sized portions you wish to make group giving easy. As you receive monetary gifts, redeem them as often as you would like. Instead of sending you the actual gifts, we send you a bank check or bank transfer so you can personally purchase the items, activities, and experiences whenever and from wherever you choose!

Description: ThunderTix is an online ticketing applications that does not charge a ticketing fee.
Full Description: ThunderTix is an event ticketing software and box office management system. ThunderTix is offered as an ongoing software as a service to venues who use it to sell tickets for their events. What makes ThunderTix unique in the industry is that NO per-ticket fees or order (processing) fees are added to any ticket. We have no contract so venues can sign up on a monthly license. The venue pays a flat monthly license fee ongoing to use the system to ThunderTix. The monthly license is based on the number of tickets sold annually. That way, the venue knows exactly what their budget is in advance regardless of how many tickets they sell. ThunderTix is a full service system from event creation and setting ticket prices to online sales, box office tools and reports, print-at-home tickets with barcodes, a barcode scanning system with option for scanner rental or purchase, and social media sharing to increase the event's visibility.

Description: Online Business Management Software
Full Description: Planning Pod is online project and business management software for small businesses. In 2006, founders Jeff Kear and Steven Feingertz were looking for a single piece of Web-based software that would allow them to manage multiple aspects of their marketing business. Unable to find it, they decided to build it, and finally released this software in March 2012. This Web-based application is like a Swiss Army knife for running a small business, pulling together a number of tools into one application to make it more convenient for entrepreneurs to be more efficient and productive. The tools inside of Planning Pod let business owners manage projects, calendars, tasks, checklists, files, documents, image galleries, contacts, proposals/estimates, invoices, contracts, time tracking, communications and more. Users can customize their Planning Pod account by uploading custom backgrounds, logos and even changing the fonts. They can also plug into other popular applications such as Google and Facebook, importing calendars and contacts from these apps.

Description: The health and wellness industry has been on a rapid incline the last few years.
Full Description: The health and wellness industry has been on a rapid incline the last few years. Plain Jane and Average Joe are finally fed up with spending counts hours at Globo gym in a fruitless attempt of exercise. They have spent days, weeks, months and years in a gym with no sense of community and little care for their members. It is no surprise that people are flocking in droves to boxes around the world. In these boxes they are achieve health and wellness goals they could never have imagined. They are finding community, friendship and competition. They are not only getting in shape, but many of them are becoming elite athletes. This is seen in no better of a place then during team competitions. Here stay at home moms strive on the same teams as ex-D1 middle linebackers. Every athlete is cheered and encouraged to show and strive for the indomitable will of the human spirit.  We believe we can catch those moments on film and allow the world to be moved by the teams and competition. With an extremely talented director leading the way we believe we can move the world. The show will show is set into a 16-team elimination series for a total of 13 episodes competing for a $200,000 grand prize. In the end we will crown one box the King of the box. In every weekly hour episode of Box Jump, one box “jumps” another box. Each box will have two teams of 6 athletes (3 women and 3 men). The teams will compete in two pre-programmed 4-person team workouts and two 2- person events. Each event will be given point values leading up to the final event. The point system will be set up that the losing team and steal the competition in the final event.  We are looking to bring the life and community that is shown in these competitions. To Truly show why all of use love this community as much as we do. This is going to be are very special project and the possibilities are nearly quite endless. This is a strong community that is growing at a rapid pace.

Description: IETF is a large open international community of network designers, operators, vendors, and researchers.
Full Description: The IETF is a large open international community of network designers, operators, vendors, and researchers concerned with the evolution of the Internet architecture and the smooth operation of the Internet. The technical work of the IETF is done in Working Groups, which are organized by topic into several Areas. Much of the work is handled via mailing lists. The IETF holds meetings three times per year.  The IETF working groups are grouped into areas, and managed by Area Directors, or ADs. The ADs are members of the Internet Engineering Steering Group (IESG). Providing architectural oversight is the Internet Architecture Board, (IAB). The IAB also adjudicates appeals when someone complains that the IESG has failed. The IAB and IESG are chartered by the Internet Society (ISOC) for these purposes. The General Area Director also serves as the chair of the IESG and of the IETF, and is an ex-officio member of the IAB. The Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) is the central coordinator for the assignment of unique parameter values for Internet protocols.

Full Description: They know they’re in the business of helping companies with information management, but they thought, why not take it a step further? Why not be more than just a face, an email, or a name? They knew if they wanted to stand apart in their service to clients, they had to have an internal environment that differed from others. The values they live by are what set us apart in their goal to be the leading information management company in California. They value community. They know their clients by name, not account numbers. All of their clients interact with their local support Corodata support team, often times having a relationship comparable to a friendship. If there is ever a problem that needs resolving, their client service representatives are often able to resolve the issue right away without having to forward clients to management. They value positivity. Their weekly meetings begin with each person sharing a good thing in their life, either work related or personal. From college graduations to the birth of grandchildren and everything in between, like any other family, they share in each other’s successes and triumphs. They value collaboration. Every month, they recognize the efforts of their staff that go above and beyond for their colleagues in the form of Corostars. Whether it’s employees working together to meet a project deadline or different departments coming together to help a client, they want to reward the extra mile their employees take to get the job done. They value integrity. They always strive to be honest, caring, and smart when it comes to handling sensitive business information. But it also means they know what it’s like to just be human and have fun. Corodata parties give us the chance to meet the families of their coworkers, and recognize another year’s efforts while looking forward to the New Year ahead. Each office is like a family of their own with potlucks, sporting events, coffee runs, breakfast days, and much more. They value the environment. It’s important to us to preserve the world in which they live. This is why they use green business practices across their company. From energy efficient storage facilities to low emissions vehicles, Corodata acts as a pioneer in making the information management industry eco-friendly.

Industry Groups: Events, Media and Entertainment
Description: Penn & Teller is an eccentric magicians and entertainers  with a psychotic twi.
Full Description: They defy labels, and at times, good taste. They've performed together for 30 years; skewering the genre of magic, their sold-out audiences, and themselves -- very often all at the same time, within one mind-boggling evening. September is an exciting month for the duo as they celebrate their fifth year as headliners in their own theater at the Rio All-suite Hotel & Casino, as well as two Emmy nominations for their Showtime series, "Penn & Teller: Bullshit!" And along the way, Penn & Teller have made the hardest trick of all a remarkable career that ranges from stage to television to three best-selling books look easy. And they've done it all on their own, distinctively offbeat terms. They call themselves a couple of eccentric guys who have learned how to do a few cool things. Since first teaming up in 1975, when they combined Teller's silent, occasionally creepy, magic with Penn's clown college education and juggling expertise, the two have created an entertainment success story that went from the streets to small clubs to national theater tours, and now to a current, multi-year engagement at the Rio All-Suite Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas. By 1985, Penn & Teller were receiving rave reviews for their Off Broadway show and Emmy award-winning PBS special, Penn & Teller Go Public. In 1987, they began the first of two successful Broadway runs. Penn & Teller had national tours throughout the 1990s, gaining critical praise from New York to San Francisco for bringing a fresh slant to an often-tired show business realm. The first of more than 20 appearances on Late Night with David Letterman soon followed, along with appearances on a wide range of television: The Tonight Show with Jay Leno, Miami Vice, Late Night with Conan O'Brien, Hollywood Squares, The Today Show, Saturday Night Live, The Drew Carey Show, Friends, Dharma & Greg, Home Improvement, and one of television's most honored rolls: animated guests on The Simpsons. They also created their own television projects, including Penn & Teller's Sin City Spectacular, Penn & Teller's Home Invasion, the Showtime movie Penn & Teller's Invisible Thread, and the NBC specials Don't Try This at Home and Penn & Teller: Off The Deep End. Penn & Teller made their big screen debut in Penn & Teller Get Killed and were featured in Walt Disney's Fantasia 2000 . In 2005 Penn & Teller lent their version of the world's dirtiest joke to the critically acclaimed documentary, The Aristocrats. The film, produced and co-created by Penn, is now available on DVD. Penn & Teller's understanding of magic and their ability to relate to audiences has also garnered serious academic attention. They serve as Visiting Scholars at MIT, that school's highest honor, and have lectured at Oxford University and the Smithsonian Institution. In 2001, they received the Hugh M. Hefner First Amendment Award. Penn & Teller have written three best-selling books, Cruel Tricks for Dear Friends, How to Play with Your Food, and How to Play in Traffic; and penned pieces in outlets ranging from The New York Times to Playboy.

Description: BayBrazil is a Silicon Valley-based not-for-profit organization dedicated to help and facilitate ties between Silicon Valley and Brazil.
Full Description: BayBrazil, bridging Silicon Valley & Brazil BayBrazil is a Silicon Valley-based not-for-profit organization dedicated to bringing together the Brazilian-American ecosystem of professionals & businesses in the Bay Area and helping to facilitate ties between Silicon Valley and Brazil. BayBrazil mission is to: * Build a tightly-knit community of Brazilian professionals, entrepreneurs, investors and scholars living in the Bay Area * Promote networking between American business professionals interested in Brazil and strengthening business ties between Silicon Valley & Brazil * Give back to the entrepreneurial community in Brazil by facilitating access to US businesses and mentoring young entrepreneurs * BayBrazil, a conduit for business between SV & Brazil * BayBrazil is a source of expert knowledge to Silicon Valley companies on how to conduct business in Brazil. We assist local firms understand and mitigate the risks of doing business with * Brazil and help these companies assess, qualify, and select potential partners in the country. BayBrazil: Interconnected community Network. Engage. Thrive. BayBrazil connects the Brazilian-American community in Silicon Valley by promoting monthly networking events to discuss technology & international business. We inform, engage & foster interaction among professionals interested in Brazil & we welcome your participation!

Description: Mazey is a communication and collaboration platform designed for groups that straddle “desk-bound” and “desk-less” worlds.
Full Description: Mazey is taking advantage of the rising wave of smartphone-wielding deskless workers. Thanks to ubiquitous wireless broadband, employees who previously were not issued a company email address, let alone a computer, are now expected to communicate with coworkers and management anytime, anywhere. For small and medium-sized organizations, Mazey replaces email, group texting, and group chat with a single, intuitive tool with a richer feature set. It eliminates the need for separate communication, file sharing and task tracking solutions that often fail to bridge the desktop-mobile worlds effectively. Mazey enables compartmentalized, asynchronous conversations that take place in context of documents and artifacts being discussed. This solves perennial challenges related to document management, version control and fragmentary knowledge capture, and ultimately improves knowledge management, accelerates knowledge retrieval and increases organizational productivity. Lastly, Mazey features a highly extensible “shared notebook” construct that can be tailored to accommodate any type of structured content that might be needed by teams to collect or retrieve data (e.g. polls and surveys, procedural checklists, time sheets, shift schedules, work orders, etc.). This flexibility ensures Mazey’s relevance across any number of specialized verticals.

Description: Dusk is an app that lets users live stream anonymously to its online community, while protecting their identity.
Full Description: Dusk is created  to allow people to safely discuss topics, confessions, and news and share real thoughts, and help find real solutions to hard problems that face our world today and tomorrow.  Remember the point of protecting your identity is not to say mean things and hide, it is designed to give users the strength to speak up, and express your honest self and create real, open and healthy dialogs people can discuss without being social convicted, and attached to what others might find offensive or not aligned with popular agendas. Your safety is our concern at all times, we have done some things to keep you safe when you use Dusk * We pixelate your video in real time, no version of your video un-pixelated ever exists (technically impossible)  * We mask your voice pitch, you can tweak this in the setting too * You can mute people who you find abusive, they will never know they have been muted * You can report people who are spamming you or being abusive  * Pin verification upon app entry, even when multitasking between apps * We never ask for any private information such as location, email address, mobile number, or anything else that hackers could steal from us. * we use end-to-end encryption even though none of your data is on the app.

Description: Established as a digital media company to amplify Ghanaian and African events, curations, culture, music, and society.
Full Description: GhanaMade Limited is a digital media company established to amplify Ghanaian and African culture, music, and society. Founded in 2016 to celebrate and connect Ghanaians at home and abroad, we have shown the vibrant culture of Ghana beyond the nation’s borders. We started our mission in response to filling the gap where Ghanaians in the diaspora are in search of a digital means of connecting back to the Homeland. Year over year, GhanaMade has been from one city to the next to capture the Ghanaian spirit across the United States, England, and Ghana. Through these travels, we have come to understand what it means to be an African of this era; how impactful it is for black people to be united; and how essential we need to celebrate ourselves. We owe much of our success to the organic growth of our mediums and the putting together of our multinational community of creatives, thought leaders, artists, visionaries, entrepreneurs, and socialites. We have positioned ourselves to be a resounding voice for the Ghanaian and African Diaspora. Here at GhanaMade we intend to continuously pursue our mission to be the premier platform for discovery, entertainment, cultural events, and regional happenings of African-wide interests.

Full Description: OneUp has been built to solve this problem: 🤓 You create evergreen content, whether it be a blog post, podcast, YouTube video, or something else 🤞 As soon as it's live, you share it (only once) across your social media accounts 😢 It's seen by only ~5% of your followers 👎 With OneUp, you can easily schedule that same evergreen post to be recycled for a specific number of times (or indefinitely), at set intervals = More engagement, more traffic, more business. Description: Event Software helps venues schedule events and manage the work in their organizations.
Full Description: Event Software helps venues schedule events and manage the work in their organizations. For over thirty years, Event Software's state-of-the-art facility and event management software has been helping venues schedule events and manage the work in their organizations. Beginning in 1984, Event Software started thanks to an MIT grant from the US Olympic Committee.  The US Olympic Committee was looking for a way to help schedule their various events using the burgeoning new field of computer technology.  What the programmers at MIT came up with was not exactly what the Olympic Committee was looking for, so they passed on the program; however another gentleman involved in the project saw that the software had potential for managing event facilities.  The software was then adapted for use in civic centers, performing arts centers, and various other venues.

Description: Lovoco innovates accessibility, communication, and educational solutions with our proprietary speech and translation AI.
Full Description: Lovoco innovates AI in language tech for accessibility, communication, and educational purposes. We invented Stenopoly, the first instantaneous bilingual subtitling AR SaaS, enabling: captions for the disabled; translations for global communicators; and higher learning outcomes for students.  Stenopoly empowers instructors and keynote speakers to present live with real-time captioning for superior cross-cultural comprehension.  Presenters with our AR software speaks, and whatever they say project on screen in two languages instantly.  Then our AI SaaS generates transcripts, video captions, abstracts, and analyses for legal compliance and production efficiencies.  Our presentation tool optimizes: visual aid; global strategic communications; and intelligence retention with visual-auditory efficacy. For every one system you purchase, we donate a system in your community to a local primary or secondary school of your choice in your honor. We also empower your AI IT capabilities with APIs: advanced speech recognition, machine translation, and natural language processing.

Managing costs and creating an engaging environment are certainly very important, but without an effective strategy for how to engage your audience you won’t maximize your results. Brave Exhibits is a trade show exhibit and event marketing agency that specializes in results.  We help companies use face-to-face marketing to grow their business.  We will help you analyze your program, develop the right strategy, and design the environment that will lead to success. To capture attention, demonstrate the value of your offerings, and do so in a memorable way takes bold choices.  To make bold choices, you have to be brave.  Be Brave.

Description: Reinventing the way we hold meetings in order to boost our mental and physical health -- by walking.
Full Description: Netwalking® is a DC-based company that is reinventing the way we hold meetings by walking together -- in order to boost our mental and physical health. We are influenced by the organizations and settings where we spend most of our time which impacts our wellbeing. After recovering from back surgery and health challenges l learned to manage chronic pain and stress through walking - which is how Netwalking was born. I created a 1.5 - 2 mile group walk that gives Netwalkers an opportunity to explore their local communities, network with business leaders, shop local, discover hidden gems and nature, as a way to connect, build a stronger community, break down barriers, increase collaboration, and stay healthy all at the same time.   Our unique approach provides clients with techniques, tools, and tips helping cultivate a welcoming environment to experience distinctive urban spaces. We offer a combination of wellness practices and facilitated conversations to improve trust, community building, and effectiveness. We give participants the tools they need to practice self-care, improve well-being AND provide a safe space for reflection and conversations about how to implement those practices.

Description: Collaborative photo and album design app
Full Description: Being photographers ourselves, we love taking photos but dislike the arduous post process.  We often find it difficult to share and discuss our photos and album designs with clients, other photographers, friends and colleagues. We feel there is still an absence for an application that would allow us to design and discuss our images more efficiently, so we created ViaPhoto.  ViaPhoto is an online application that makes it easy for photographers to organize, design and discuss photos. To start, clients create color labels to organize the photos in the collection.  Photos can either be shared privately, shared with others or auto-design using our easy-to-use album designer. ViaPhoto also makes it easy to proof and discuss photos by allowing users to make comments directly on the image in real-time. It's like your clients are right there beside you. ViaPhoto is great for all types of photography and photographers.  Whether you are a seasoned pro or just beginning, ViaPhoto has endless possibilities that will make your work more productive and efficient.

Description: Intelligent location management for internal and field business operations, impactful visitor engagement and location intelligence (LI).
Full Description: Why LocaleIQ LocaleIQ™ is a multi-tenant SaaS intelligent location management solution that enables customers to bring together valuable geographical, IoT/sensors and people to collaborate in a seamless environment with no expertise.  Providing smart cities, smart industry, smart building, venues, outdoor recreation and many other verticals with a solution that can unlock GIS data, IoT/sensor telemetry and people inputs to provide better information, operations and analytics for their organizations and their customers.  Customers can now easily manage maps, content, location-based projects, events, asset and inventory tracking along with real-time and scheduled updates to accessibility, closures, alerts and more.  Empowering the right people with the right tools to manage their location business whether it is a smart city, smart factory or recreation area. Innovation Businesses have been using multiple, old, complex technology solutions that required training and expertise to manage their location operations, thus restricting management of this data to a few, highly trained employees.  LocaleIQ’s SaaS platform offers a single solution, with map drawing tools and smart forms that any staff member can use whether in the office, or from the field to publish real-time location updates to their interactive digital maps and websites. Disruption We are creating a NEW SOLUTION CATEGORY that combines multiple solutions into a single, easy to use platform that opens the doors for any staff member to contribute to location-based information management and online publishing. By offering predictable, affordable pricing and a single, map agnostic solution we save our customers money, resources, and time and give them a way to reach their customers through interactive digital maps that they haven’t been able to do up until now! Our Expertise Nau Media’s team are proven leaders that have delivered best in class enterprise and SMB solutions and are domain experts in enterprise SaaS platforms and digital mapping.  We have met with hundreds of experts in the roles of GIS, digital mapping, government land management, and outdoor recreation related industries to ensure that we build a platform that meets our target customers’ digital mapping and media management needs with one integrated business solution.

Description: Spony makes sponsorship simple for Personal, College, Sports, Community events etc. Spony connects event owners with sponsors in minutes.
Full Description: Simple sponsorship deals can be completed in minutes instead of a few weeks like with traditional sponsorship deals.  With Spony, anyone can post any event with specific sponsorship request with just a few taps on their phone. Interested nearby business owners or other potential sponsors who are looking to promote themselves or their business, services, or products locally can connect with the event owners instantly via in-app chat. === Spony Highlights === •	Events can be as simple as work functions, family gatherings, or school events. •	Requests from sponsors can be as simple as food, beverages, or just simply funding ! •	Sponsors can be individuals, local stores, restaurants, doctors, trainers, salons, etc. •	Anyone can post an event with a sponsorship request within minutes. •	Sponsors and event owners can connect instantly via in-app chat. •	Not much typing required. •	No setup, registration or prior sponsorship experience required ! •	Free to use! === Benefits for Event Owners ===   •	Save money by getting free/discounted products or services. •	Save time with a simple platform for connecting with sponsors. •	Make your events more memorable, exciting and interesting. •	Build a network with local business owners.   === Benefits for Sponsors === •	Promote yourself, your product, service, or business and increase brand awareness locally. •	Easily connect with prospective local customers and event owners. •	Drive sales by distributing fliers/coupons throughout the events you sponsor. •	Save money by reducing your advertising budget. •	Engage only with an extremely local customer base with the power of hyper-local, hyper-targeted marketing.

Description: Online event management solution
Full Description: Eventat is a self-service event management and online registration solution that helps event organizers successfully manage and sell out their events. For event organizers, posting an event on Eventat is always free. Organizers can sell tickets, manage attendees, and collect payment for their events, amongst other tools. They can collect payment for their events through various third-party payment services, including PayPal and Google Checkout. For larger event organizers who own an Authorize.net merchant account, you can collect direct credit card payments using Authorize.net at no additional cost.  For event attendees, Eventat includes the ability to interact with one another via comments, shared photos, and shared videos. The company's post-event feedback system offers attendees the opportunity to leave organizers a comment and a rating for events that they have attended. This gives Eventat members the opportunity to build a strong network of event organizers and events to choose from.  Eventat does not currently charge a per-ticket-fee for paid events.

Description: Wednik is an online wedding management service.
Full Description: Wednik provides DIY wedding planning tools and wedding planners marketplace where experienced planners offer affordable services to guide & assist the brides remotely.  Wednik provides a suite of intelligent tools for budgeting, planning, tracking and collaboration. For brides who need help can choose to work with a remote wedding planner for as little as $199. Wednik lets brides to collaborate with their friends and family to get ideas and share tasks. It also provides financial planning guidance to help brides figure the budget they can afford and makes a saving and borrowing plan for them to have enough for the wedding. Wednik stays vendor neutral and lets the brides find good vendors via Yelp and Google places.   Disruption: 1. Remote Planners - Change the way Wedding Planners work. Most wedding planning tasks can be done remotely. Our wedding planner market place will connect brides and planners that may not be in the same location. This results into more business for the planners and affordable prices for the brides. 2.  Vendor neutral - Instead of providing a directory of vendors who pay to get listed, Wednik stays Vendor neutral. We give brides access to Yelp and Google place results so they get a fair view of vendors. This eliminates the need for vendors paying high listing fees to wedding websites like Wedding Wire. 3. Responsible Borrowing - By inserting financial planning into the wedding planning process we intend to change how couples budget and finance their wedding. This will impact the wedding loan business in the US.

Description: Cause-Related Dating and Volunteering
Full Description: YourCauseOrMine is the leading meet online/date offline social site that matches members based on location, cause interests and site activity and provides a platform for individuals and groups to meet, connect and volunteer together. Members can identify their interest and involvement in various causes, search for profile matches among other members, join groups based on their interests and make plans to volunteer with or attend local cause-related events. The YourCauseOrMine concept is centered around cause-related match-making and doing good in local communities. This site is for anyone who wants to meet people with purpose. YourCauseOrMine is where someone interested in a cause can meet someone else also interested in a cause – even if it is a different cause. Member interests vary by focus and intensity; some members carry a moderate concern, while others possess a fiery passion for a cause.  There are 18 different cause categories with multiple sub-categories from which to select interests.  Based on those identified interests YourCauseOrMine helps you to you meet new people, represent your interest(s), get involved in cause initiatives, and learn about cause-related events in your area.  Even before you meet anyone on the site, you know that everyone here cares about something. Users who opt to arrange their first dates at the site-recommended volunteer events enjoy a lower-pressure environment, virtually free of the posturing and awkward silences that so many dread on typical first dates.

Industries: Event Management, Events, Financial Services, Internet, Social Media
Industry Groups: Events, Financial Services, Internet Services, Media and Entertainment
Description: BestCalls.com operates an Internet directory of investor events.
Full Description: BestCalls.com was the industry's first earnings conference call directory for individual investors.  Founder Mark Coker started BestCalls after he was denied access to an earnings conference call by Legato Systems (story at http://www.sfgate.com/business/article/Individual-Shareholders-Have-the-Power-With-New-2938601.php).  The company lobbied the SEC for open access to conference calls, and was ultimately one of several catalysts for the SEC's REGULATION FAIR DISCLOSURE, a.k.a. "Reg FD."  Reg FD provided publicly traded companies permission to satisfy their fair disclosure obligations by allowing all investors on their earnings conference calls.  BestCalls was acquired by Shareholder.com in April 2003.  Shareholder.com was acquired by the NASDAQ stock exchange the next year.  NASDAQ continued operating BestCalls for another five or six years before ending the service.

Description: Transformative P2P Marketplaces & Business Platform for MICE
Full Description: TRACTIMO is a startup company striving to revolutionize the global $400bn MICE industry with its unique business platform and innovative marketplace projects.  In short, we are an e-commerce company with proven track record of changing the way how individual services behind Meetings, Incentives, Conferences, and Exhibitions are promoted and contracted. We have started our quest back in 2013 with the most difficult challenge in event management – weddings – and solved broken process of their cancellations. As most of you know, weddings are expensive, very personal and therefore very difficult to handle. Canceling them isn’t much cheaper. Only in the US, each year 13 % weddings get cancelled making it a market worth $7bil of the total $55bil wedding market. Our secondary marketplace project CanceledWeddings.com offers unique social brokerage features for wedding service contracting, negotiation and secure transfers to cost savvy couples. It’s a win-win for everyone because the selling couple doesn’t lose all their money sunk in nonrefundable deposits and cancellation fees while the buying couple gets a really good bargain. At the same time, wedding service providers have now a simple solution how to deal with wedding cancellations and unsold late availabilities. They don’t lose a date that they weren’t able to sell at full price and even enjoy new incremental revenues. But wait, it’s not all only about e-commerce of weddings and honeymoons. If you look around at how different market segments and whole industries have changed due to the Internet and the network economy, you realize that for the MICE industry to adapt, it has to change. We, at TRACTIMO, are here to disrupt the status quo and enable this change.

Description: Kvl Audio Visual Services  is a Provider of premier audio-visual services and technology.
Full Description: Since 1976, when we pioneered the concept of providing dedicated, in-house event technology services to hotels and meeting venues, the KVL Audio Visual company has been delivering solutions for our customers. Over the years, we have grown to become a nationally-recognized provider of premier audio-visual services and technology, supporting conference centers, conventions, and trade shows, and fulfilling the meeting and presentation needs of businesses and organizations of all sizes. From pre-production planning, consultation, and state-of-the-art equipment rental, to staging, design and installation, KVL provides it all. We handle the simplest presentations as well as the most complex stage projects, and our technical and creative expertise ensures seamless, professional productions delivered via the latest AV technologies. We attribute our success to a relentless focus on our core principles of service, reliability, and expertise. We provide customers the reassurance that their project will be completed smoothly, on-time and to their specifications. To this end, each customer is assigned a dedicated account manager to oversee each stage of their job, as well as a team of professional and knowledgeable technicians dedicated to exceeding our customers’ every expectation. In addition to the more than ninety in-house locations we operate for hotels and convention centers, KVL maintains offices throughout the United States allowing us to serve customers both locally and nationally.
